result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:32 AM Defendant Nicholas Scott Werling in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney David E Saperstein by video.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Austin Harter sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects without argument.   Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Notice of Hearing, 5/16/22-Preliminary Hearing,  NOT RECEIVED TIMELY TO FORWARD (Defendant Nicholas Scott Werling)
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Activity:  Adjourned initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:30 AM Defendant Nicholas Scott Werling in court, in person in custody at the Rock County Jail with attorney David E Saperstein by video.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Austin Harter appeared by video.  State argues for bond modification, adding conditions. Defense objects with argument. Court orders bond modification with conditions: Possess no weapons. Absolute Sobriety  Curfew: Defendant must stay in his residence from 6pm to 6am, except for employment.  No contact directly or indirectly with victim ATR, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. GPS monitoring if released.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Not to be within 500 feet of any schools. Court finds good cause to reschedule Preliminary Hearing due to Officers poor connection.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
